resources.string: Accessibility services are enabled but not running, you can try re-enabling or restarting your phone
Failed to enable accessibility service with root privileges
Use a foreground service to keep your app running
Accessibility service tasks must be enabled to execute (reserved)
You must open the floating window to view the log (reserved item)
Volume up key stops all scripts
After opening, running the script will automatically open the accessibility service with Root privileges (reserved item)
Automatically enable services with root privileges
Layout analysis is more stable when enabled, but a small number of scripts may not work properly. Restart accessibility service to take effect
Do not display the main interface
Run the script directly after opening the app
The log interface is not displayed, and script support is required to open this interface next time
Password must be greater than 5 characters

The software needs to open \"Accessibility Services\" to run, please open \"Settings->Accessibility Services\" or \"Settings->Accessibility Services->More Downloaded Services\", find \" %s \", and enable Accessibility Services
Accessibility services need to be enabled
The notification bar will always display the \"This app is running\" notification to keep the program running
